categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Technical Discussions (January 6-7, 2026)

content.text:
## Discord Plugin Issues and Fixes

A user (DigitalDiva) encountered persistent issues with the Discord plugin not detecting server IDs, usernames, or server ownership despite proper configuration. The error "No server ID found 10" was traced to version compatibility issues between ElizaOS 1.7.0 and plugin-discord 1.3.3. Odilitime identified the problem as a transition from `serverId` to `messageServerId` in the codebase and created a fix branch (odi-17) to address bootstrap actions/providers issues. A formal PR (#6333) was submitted to fix plugin-bootstrap and SQL minor actions/providers for serverId compatibility. The team recommended users experiencing similar issues either wait for the fix or temporarily use version 1.6.5.

## New Contributor Onboarding

A blockchain and AI engineer (aicodeflow.dev) joined the community expressing interest in contributing to ElizaOS, particularly around agent autonomy with constraints, onchain execution layers with guardrails, prediction markets/event-driven systems, and observability tooling. Odilitime, the lead dev on Spartan, welcomed them and suggested starting by reading the code and working on existing plugins. The team pointed to the elizaos-plugins GitHub organization and recommended connecting with core developers. The contributor was directed to explore the Spartan project for DeFi utilities.

## Token Migration and Contract Address Visibility

Community members raised concerns about the difficulty of finding official ElizaOS contract addresses (CA) across team-managed X accounts. Users noted it was too hard for most people to locate the correct CAs within 10 seconds on the website or Twitter. The team acknowledged the issue, with shaw confirming they would address it. Discussion ensued about whether to include CAs in bios or pinned tweets, with the team noting that most top projects don't follow this pattern but agreeing the current flow doesn't work well. A solution involving updating the Linktree to point to CoinGecko was mentioned as being in progress.

## Database Migration Issues

A developer encountered destructive migration errors when running `elizaos start` a second time, with the system blocking changes that would drop existing columns. The error required either deleting the `.eliza` folder or setting `ELIZA_ALLOW_DESTRUCTIVE_MIGRATIONS=true`. Community helpers explained this is safe for local development and recommended using `elizaos dev` command instead of `elizaos start` for continuous monitoring during development.

## Core Development Updates

The core dev team discussed several technical improvements:

- Stan submitted multiple PRs to improve monorepo latency and shared documentation on hybrid architecture with persistent workers exploration
- Odilitime noted that using personal Claude API keys in Cursor doesn't provide the Cursor-optimized version of Claude
- The team identified incorrect information about EigenLayer appearing on their website that was being picked up by LLMs
- Discussion of NVIDIA's Rubin platform announcement, noting Blackwell is now old news with GTX 6000 series as the new chip
- Neo's Rust-inspired ElizaOS alternative "Zoey" was shared, though received mixed reactions
- Stan worked on cloud fixes for TOCTOU race conditions using a deduct-before, reconcile-after approach
- Discussion of gateway architecture for different connectors, with consideration for scaling event pumps and preprocessing

## Plugin Development and Integration

AlleyBoss shared an updated library for experimenting with x402 protocol integrated with ElizaOS: `npm i @alleyboss/micropay-solana-x402-paywall`. The team also shared GitHub's agentic workflows documentation as a reference resource. Stan submitted PRs for unified messaging API implementation in both Telegram and Discord plugins. A developer encountered a "Model not found" error when building ElizaOS cloud agents, which was resolved by using proper model parameter formats with provider prefixes (e.g., `openai/gpt-4o-mini`, `anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5`).

## Community and Marketing

HackMD reached out expressing support for ElizaOS builders using their platform. The team discussed DegenAI updates, with some suggesting it could be consolidated into ElizaOS for more utility, though the new version hasn't shipped yet. Community members noted increased GitHub activity and expressed bullish sentiment about the project's trajectory. ElizaOS was featured in content discussing AI agents and the creator economy.

**Issue #6332: Excessive Memory Consumption in Turbo Build**

A performance issue has been reported where Turbo build is consuming excessive memory, reaching 21GB or more. This issue was reported by madjin and requires investigation to optimize memory usage during the build process.

**Issue #6331: Model Not Found Error with Agent ID**

A bug has been identified where using an agent ID with API endpoints results in a "Model not found" error. This issue was reported by madjin and affects the API functionality when attempting to reference models using agent identifiers.

During the period from January 6 to January 7, 2026, the elizaos/eliza repository showed minimal development activity. There were no new pull requests created or merged during this timeframe. However, the repository did see 2 new issues opened, with 2 contributors actively participating in the project during these two days.
sources: From 2026-01-06 to 2026-01-07, elizaos/eliza had 0 new PRs (0 merged), 2 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

content.text: This topic focuses on the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project. However, the provided source does not contain specific information about who the contributors are, their contribution statistics, or details about their involvement in the project. To provide accurate information about the top contributors, the source would need to include data such as contributor names, number of commits, lines of code contributed, or other relevant metrics.
